channel.title: [508]wild interface

item.title: [508]wild interface
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

Ok so im trying to call an interface that shows the skull and crossbones. when you are in wild it says “wild” under it, when in safe it says “safe” under it. i got all this working EXCEPT
iv had 2 problems with this,

  1. i have the interfaces called through processes, so it changes as soon as you cross the wild/non wild coords. but everytime it reloads the interface and your right clicked on something, it exits out of the right click box.

  2. i changed my code around so it would only call it once but still check for if your in wild non wild

		if(iswild() == true && wildface == 0){
		frames.setString(this, "<col=FF0000>Wild", 380, 1);
		frames.setOverlay(this, 380);
		wildface = 1;
		}else if(iswild() == false && wildface == 1){
		frames.setString(this, "<col=00FF00>Safe", 380, 1);
		frames.setOverlay(this, 380);
		wildface = 0;
		}

iswild() is where the coords for my wild areas are at
wildface is an INT created to try and fix the first problem i was having, but after doing that i got this problem
right when you log in it doesnt show the interface untill you switch from wild to non wild, and vice versa.
i know why its doing this im just not sure how to fix it, its doing it because it loads that wildface = 1, as soon as it try’s to load the interface, which causes it to not meet the requirements of showing the interface. It also exits out of the interface when you tele, do to the same problem i just mentioned

Read full topic
